text: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
author: William James

text: Do the best you can until you know better. Then when you know better, do better.
author: Maya Angelou

text: What you do makes a difference, and you have to decide what kind of difference you want to make.
author: Jane Goodall

text: Sometimes the bravest thing you can do is just show up.
author: Brené Brown

text: No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another.
author: Charles Dickens

text: You may not control all the events that happen to you, but you can decide not to be reduced by them.
author: Maya Angelou

text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston Churchill

text: You don’t have to see the whole staircase, just take the first step.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: The smallest act of kindness is worth more than the grandest intention.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Courage doesn’t always roar. Sometimes courage is the quiet voice at the end of the day saying, ‘I will try again tomorrow.’
author: Mary Anne Radmacher

text: Believe you can and you’re halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: The best way out is always through.
author: Robert Frost

text: If you’re going through hell, keep going.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Sometimes even to live is an act of courage.
author: Seneca

text: Wherever there is a human being, there is an opportunity for kindness.
author: Seneca

text: The world is changed by your example, not by your opinion.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: Hardships often prepare ordinary people for an extraordinary destiny.
author: C.S. Lewis

text: You can’t go back and change the beginning, but you can start where you are and change the ending.
author: C.S. Lewis

text: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.
author: Albert Einstein

text: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: It’s not whether you get knocked down, it’s whether you get up.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: You are enough just as you are.
author: Meghan Markle

text: Not everything that is faced can be changed, but nothing can be changed until it is faced.
author: James Baldwin

text: We don’t develop courage by being happy every day. We develop it by surviving difficult times.
author: Barbara De Angelis

text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Knowing what must be done does away with fear.
author: Rosa Parks

text: You miss 100 percent of the shots you don’t take.
author: Wayne Gretzky

text: If your actions inspire others to dream more, learn more, do more, and become more, you are a leader.
author: John Quincy Adams

text: Well done is better than well said.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: I am not afraid of storms, for I am learning how to sail my ship.
author: Louisa May Alcott

text: Energy and persistence conquer all things.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: It is not length of life, but depth of life.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Nothing will work unless you do.
author: Maya Angelou

text: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Do not judge me by my successes, judge me by how many times I fell down and got back up again.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
author: Confucius

text: Fall seven times and stand up eight.
author: Japanese Proverb

text: What we think, we become.
author: Buddha

text: When one door closes, another opens.
author: Alexander Graham Bell

text: Do not let making a living prevent you from making a life.
author: John Wooden

text: The future depends on what you do today.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Quality is not an act, it is a habit.
author: Aristotle

text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

text: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
author: Aristotle

text: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life.
author: Seneca

text: Waste no more time arguing about what a good person should be. Be one.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: If it is not right, do not do it; if it is not true, do not say it.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: He who fears death will never do anything worth of a living man.
author: Seneca

text: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
author: Seneca

text: Man is disturbed not by things, but by the views he takes of them.
author: Epictetus

text: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.
author: Epictetus

text: No man is free who is not master of himself.
author: Epictetus

text: Our life is what our thoughts make it.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.
author: Seneca

text: He who has health has hope; and he who has hope has everything.
author: Thomas Carlyle

text: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one’s courage.
author: Anaïs Nin

text: Nothing can dim the light that shines from within.
author: Maya Angelou

text: If opportunity doesn’t knock, build a door.
author: Milton Berle

text: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: Make each day your masterpiece.
author: John Wooden

text: It is our choices that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.
author: J.K. Rowling

text: Perseverance is not a long race; it is many short races one after the other.
author: Walter Elliot

text: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
author: Buddha

text: The measure of who we are is what we do with what we have.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: In matters of conscience, the law of the majority has no place.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Be kind whenever possible. It is always possible.
author: Dalai Lama

text: The best preparation for tomorrow is doing your best today.
author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

text: What we do for ourselves dies with us. What we do for others remains and is immortal.
author: Albert Pike

text: The art of life is to know how to enjoy a little and to endure very much.
author: William Hazlitt

text: Out of difficulties grow miracles.
author: Jean de La Bruyère

text: Patience and perseverance have a magical effect before which difficulties disappear.
author: John Quincy Adams

text: The human spirit is stronger than anything that can happen to it.
author: C.C. Scott

text: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Well begun is half done.
author: Aristotle

text: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
author: Aristotle

text: We must be the change we wish to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Nothing worth having comes easy.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: The most effective way to do it, is to do it.
author: Amelia Earhart

text: If you can dream it, you can do it.
author: Walt Disney

text: It always seems impossible until it’s done.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Be faithful in small things because it is in them that your strength lies.
author: Mother Teresa

text: We become what we think about.
author: Earl Nightingale

text: The meaning of life is to find your gift. The purpose of life is to give it away.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: Don’t watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
author: Sam Levenson

text: Turn your wounds into wisdom.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: Act without expectation.
author: Lao Tzu

text: If you want to lift yourself up, lift up someone else.
author: Booker T. Washington

text: It is not the years in your life that count. It is the life in your years.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Nothing in life is to be feared; it is only to be understood.
author: Marie Curie

text: The greatest wealth is health.
author: Virgil

text: I attribute my success to this: I never gave or took any excuse.
author: Florence Nightingale

text: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: The more I want to get something done, the less I call it work.
author: Richard Bach

text: What we achieve inwardly will change outer reality.
author: Plutarch

text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

text: Keep your face always toward the sunshine—and shadows will fall behind you.
author: Walt Whitman

text: A person who never made a mistake never tried anything new.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The power of imagination makes us infinite.
author: John Muir

text: If you cannot do great things, do small things in a great way.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: Everything you can imagine is real.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: Do not wait to strike till the iron is hot; but make it hot by striking.
author: William Butler Yeats

text: Life is made of ever so many partings welded together.
author: Charles Dickens

text: You must do the things you think you cannot do.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched — they must be felt with the heart.
author: Helen Keller

text: The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity.
author: Dorothy Parker

text: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
author: Aristotle

text: It is never too late to be what you might have been.
author: George Eliot

text: You cannot shake hands with a clenched fist.
author: Indira Gandhi

text: The only journey is the one within.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

text: Do not let yesterday take up too much of today.
author: Will Rogers

text: The longer I live, the more beautiful life becomes.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

text: Life is really generous to those who pursue their personal legend.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: The secret of happiness is freedom, the secret of freedom is courage.
author: Thucydides

text: We rise by lifting others.
author: Robert Ingersoll

text: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
author: Peter Drucker

text: What we fear of doing most is usually what we most need to do.
author: Tim Ferriss

text: Turn your face to the sun and the shadows fall behind you.
author: Maori Proverb

text: One person can make a difference, and everyone should try.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: A problem is a chance for you to do your best.
author: Duke Ellington

text: Life begins at the end of your comfort zone.
author: Neale Donald Walsch

text: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: What counts in life is not the mere fact that we have lived. It is what difference we have made.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: The only real mistake is the one from which we learn nothing.
author: Henry Ford

text: Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The unexamined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates

text: Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Willing is not enough; we must do.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: There is no substitute for hard work.
author: Thomas Edison

text: Light tomorrow with today.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

text: Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear—not absence of fear.
author: Mark Twain

text: If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, go together.
author: African Proverb

text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: He who is not courageous enough to take risks will accomplish nothing in life.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: In matters of conscience, the law of the majority has no place.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: The only source of knowledge is experience.
author: Albert Einstein

text: A life is not important except in the impact it has on other lives.
author: Jackie Robinson

text: It takes courage to grow up and become who you really are.
author: E.E. Cummings

text: The meaning of life is to find your gift. The purpose of life is to give it away.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: We can do no great things, only small things with great love.
author: Mother Teresa

text: What you do speaks so loudly that I cannot hear what you say.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The future starts today, not tomorrow.
author: Pope John Paul II

text: The measure of intelligence is the ability to change.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Be the change that you wish to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: To improve is to change; to be perfect is to change often.
author: Winston Churchill

text: The more you know yourself, the more patience you have for what you see in others.
author: Erik Erikson

text: The important thing is not to stop questioning.
author: Albert Einstein

text: One today is worth two tomorrows.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Life is not measured by the number of breaths we take, but by the moments that take our breath away.
author: Maya Angelou

text: If you light a lamp for someone else it will also brighten your path.
author: Buddha

text: The mind is not a vessel to be filled, but a fire to be kindled.
author: Plutarch

text: It is not enough to be busy; so are the ants. The question is: what are we busy about?
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Act as if it were impossible to fail.
author: Dorothea Brande

text: The price of greatness is responsibility.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Nothing is impossible, the word itself says ‘I’m possible’.
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: What we do in life echoes in eternity.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Knowing what is right does not mean much unless you do what is right.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.
author: Helen Keller

text: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Action expresses priorities.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a harder battle.
author: Plato

text: An unexamined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates

text: The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.
author: Edmund Burke

text: You have power over your mind — not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: The energy of the mind is the essence of life.
author: Aristotle

text: To handle yourself, use your head; to handle others, use your heart.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: He who learns but does not think, is lost. He who thinks but does not learn is in great danger.
author: Confucius

text: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: The best portion of a good person’s life is their little, nameless, unremembered acts of kindness.
author: William Wordsworth

text: It is our attitude at the beginning of a difficult task which, more than anything else, will affect its successful outcome.
author: William James

text: A calm mind brings inner strength and self-confidence.
author: Dalai Lama

text: The time is always right to do what is right.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: What we see depends mainly on what we look for.
author: John Lubbock

text: If you do not change direction, you may end up where you are heading.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Great things are done by a series of small things brought together.
author: Vincent van Gogh

text: Life can only be understood backwards; but it must be lived forwards.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

text: Strength does not come from physical capacity. It comes from an indomitable will.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: We acquire the strength we have overcome.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: A person who never made a mistake never tried anything new.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.

text: When you have exhausted all possibilities, remember this: you haven’t.

text: Do not let what you cannot do interfere with what you can do.
author: John Wooden

text: If you want to conquer fear, do not sit home and think about it. Go out and get busy.

text: The most wasted of days is one without laughter.
author: E.E. Cummings

text: We are here to add what we can to life, not to get what we can from life.

text: The only real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes.

text: I am not discouraged, because every wrong attempt discarded is another step forward.
author: Thomas Edison

text: The greatest use of a life is to spend it on something that will outlast it.
author: William James

text: What you leave behind is not what is engraved in stone monuments, but what is woven into the lives of others.
author: Pericles

text: It is not enough to have lived. We should be determined to live for something.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Be curious, not judgmental.
author: Walt Whitman

text: The meaning of life is to give life meaning.
author: Viktor Frankl

text: Between stimulus and response there is a space. In that space is our power to choose our response.
author: Viktor Frankl

text: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Life is never made unbearable by circumstances, but only by lack of meaning and purpose.
author: Viktor Frankl

text: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

text: The best things in life are nearest: breath in your nostrils, light in your eyes.

text: Every strike brings me closer to the next home run.
author: Babe Ruth

text: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.

text: The secret of getting things done is to act.
author: Dante Alighieri

text: Well done is better than well said.

text: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: The most important thing is to enjoy your life—to be happy—it’s all that matters.

text: Nothing is worth more than this day.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: The greatest weapon against stress is our ability to choose one thought over another.

text: If you cannot find peace within yourself, you will never find it anywhere else.

text: Character is higher than intellect.

text: We become what we habitually do.

text: Time is the wisest counselor of all.

text: It is easier to build strong children than to repair broken men.

text: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.

text: The art of living is more like wrestling than dancing.

text: We shape our tools and thereafter our tools shape us.

text: The simple things are also the most extraordinary things.

text: Adopt the pace of nature: her secret is patience.

text: A good head and a good heart are always a formidable combination.

text: Act without expectation.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.

text: You cannot find peace by avoiding life.

text: The measure of a person’s real character is what they would do if they knew they would never be found out.

text: Do not wait for leaders; do it alone, person to person.

text: We cannot solve our problems with the same thinking we used when we created them.

text: The more one judges, the less one loves.

text: You cannot protect yourself from sadness without protecting yourself from happiness.

text: The strongest principle of growth lies in the human choice.

text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.

text: A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.

text: What lies behind you and what lies in front of you pales in comparison to what lies inside of you.

text: Freedom is the open window through which pours the sunlight of the human spirit.

text: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.

text: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.

text: Keep your eyes on the stars, and your feet on the ground.

text: Do not be embarrassed by your failures, learn from them and start again.

text: The purpose of life is not to be happy. It is to be useful, to be honorable, to be compassionate.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: You gain strength, courage, and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: If you do what you’ve always done, you’ll get what you’ve always gotten.
author: Tony Robbins

text: The best way to cheer yourself is to try to cheer someone else up.
author: Mark Twain

text: The most courageous act is still to think for yourself. Aloud.
author: Coco Chanel

text: Nothing strengthens authority so much as silence.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: We are made wise not by the recollection of our past, but by the responsibility for our future.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Life is trying things to see if they work.
author: Ray Bradbury

text: The most effective way to do it, is to do it.
author: Amelia Earhart

text: Where there is love there is life.
author: Mahatma Gandhi
